fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA highlight specific column with color in Column Configuration page:

!Screenshot 2016-09-02 09.57.36.png|thumbnail! 

But the same colour is not applied to the Active Sprint page.

 !Screenshot 2016-09-02 09.57.10.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the same colour configuration in Column Configuration to Active Sprint

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Add column colour in backlog

fields.description:
The rapid view really got my attention because I saw that grid and thought "aha, I bet the rows and columns can be defined by any arbitrary JQL statements"... then I looked at the documentation and it appears that the columns must map to status values.

But it is close to a generic grid control for viewing JIRA issues.

I have a use case for such a generic grid control.  Our group uses JIRA for tracking a variety of government decision-making tasks.  Things like the decision process for deciding whether a species should be listed as threatened or endangered.  These kind of processes have a lot of steps.  It hasn't seemed very useful to create workflows for the detailed steps of these processes... but, it is possible to use JQL queries to sift out the processes that are in similar stages, for example, those processes that are under legal review.  We would find it really useful to have a grid view of JIRA issues that we could configure with arbitrary JQL statements.  

Of course we would want to be able to define multiple such views, with differing grid definitions.  And we would want to be able to display these grids via dashboard gadgets.

Thanks for considering our request!
fields.summary: Generic grid views with rows and columns defined by JQL queries

fields.description:
When creating a sample project/board the issues in the Done column should be resolved.
The current state is incorrect as generated by JIM (?).
fields.summary: Sample data issues in the Done column are not resolved
DevOps Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When on backlog view if you try to create a new issue via open create dialog the issue does not go in the sprint. This only happens if you don't have the field sprint in the create issue screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Scrum Software project.
# Remove the Sprint field from the create issue screen.
# Create a new Scrum board based on this project.
# Open the backlog view.
# Create a new sprint.
# Select create new issue inside the new sprint and type the issue summary (do not press enter).
# Select the three dots button (open create dialog)
# Fill the create issue screen and create the issue.
# The new issue will be sent to the backlog.

!218313.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The new issue should have the sprint set.

h3. Workaround
Add the sprint field to the create issue screen.
fields.summary: When on backlog view if you try to create a new issue via open create dialog the issue does not go in the sprint.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currenly, JIRA will show issues under Epic Link in Issue page according to the when the issue was linked to the epic. User would like to have ability to change the order such as sorting according to alphabetical or issue type.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add ability to sort issues under Epic Link according to alphabetical or issue type.

h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Sort issues under Epic Link according to specific condition

fields.description:
If you are using Fisheye / Crucible or even the DVCS Plugin, the source tab in JIRA includes links for other projects.

IE: Your JIRA project is ATP and you have also a repository that users are adding CR-ATP-1 in the commit message. 

JIRA's ATP-1 source tab will contain references to the CR-ATP-1 commit.
fields.summary: Source tab includes links for other projects

fields.description:
*Problem*
If external application link's authorization settings are inconsistent, JIRA silently skips loading plugins from remote system (Bamboo, e.g)

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create reciprocal app link to Bamboo (Bamboo server should be executed)  on Administration/Application links Jira page.
# Ensure that incoming/outgoing auth. settings are inconsistent (disable both OAuth and Trusted auth on Jira side, e.g.).
# Go to dashboard screen and try to find Bamboo gadgets

*Result*
No gadgets are found, no error/warning messages are displayed.
Jira logs contain many records similar to the following:
{code}
2016-03-25 21:47:34,030 DirectoryEntryResolverThread-13 WARN jirauser 1290x149x1 1tk8wcq 127.0.0.1 /rest/config/1.0/directoryitems/local.json [c.a.g.r.internal.http.HttpClientFetcher] A request t
o http://black-virtualbox:8085/bamboo/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.bamboo.gadgets/status/planStatus.xml has been denied.  To allow requests to this URL add the application URL to your whiteli
st (http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/KQfCDQ ).
{code}
*Expected Result*
Error or warning sign with comprehensive explanation is displayed in the user interface.
fields.summary: Jira does not provide any clue in the UI when bamboo gadgets can not be retrieved

fields.description:
Application links between JIRA and Bamboo are successfully created and Bamboo builds can be seen in JIRA:
!bblink.png|thumbnail!

!builddev.png|thumbnail!

However, from Administration -> Add-ons -> Builds/Bamboo configuration, it's stated that:
{panel}
You do not currently have any Bamboo application links configured. Click here to add one.
{panel}

!bbconf.png|thumbnail!

This is unexpected and confusing.
fields.summary: Bamboo application does not show on Bamboo Configuration page

fields.description:
Trying to Release a version from JIRA brings the user to the Version Detail page, however the regular Pop-up for JIRA does not appear. 

Because of this the Version Release cannot be built from JIRA and must be built manually in Bamboo.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a Version in JIRA
# Make sure the Project is linked to Bamboo
# Go to the Version screen and select 'Build and Release'
* You are now placed in the Version screen with no dialog.
fields.summary: Release and Build option does not bring up Dialog

fields.description:
The steps to reproduce this:
# Create a version in JIRA and trigger a Bamboo plan when releasing that version in JIRA
# Navigate to the Bamboo build result page and manually link that build result to a JIRA issue
# Click on the linked JIRA issue key and you will see the null values as depicted in the attached screenshots.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't pull the build details from Bamboo if the Bamboo build is triggered by releasing a version in JIRA
Jira 5.0-rc3 source build still fails on com.atlassian.jira.plugins:jira-bamboo-plugin [5.0-rc1]

fields.description:
h4. Summary
The version dropdown is not rendering properly when doing _Build and Release_ and have a long Version name. Having 1.0 or 2.0 it will show fine as it is very short in length.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Setup JIRA 6.2.7 or 6.3.7
# Setup Bamboo and configure Application Link (Tested on Bamboo 5.6.2)
# Create a new and long Version name. Example "Version Long Name 1.0"
# Assign at least one Unresolved JIRA issue to "Version Long Name 1.0" to Affected version.
# Go to Projects > Version tab 
# On "Version Long Name 1.0", click on the Cog menu and choose _Build and Release_

h4. Additional Information
* It is not reproducible when JIRA is not connected to Bamboo, or when choosing _Build_
* Reproducible on Firefox 32

!build-n-release-rendering.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Version Dropdown Not Rendering Properly when Build and Release

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the bug:
* Add to your dashboard the bamboo plans gadget
* You cannot see the title of the gadget because instead of being white, it's blue by default as the header of the gadget (dashboard-item-title) .

See images attached
fields.summary: Bamboo plans gadget title is not visible if background is blue

fields.description:
Problem:
When releasing a Version via JIRA's Build and Release functionality, if a Bamboo plan exists that the user has "Build" permissions to, but not "View" permissions, JIRA throws an error on the screen and won't let the user continue to Release the Version.
See a release with a plan that has both Build and View permissions: !jirareleasegood.png|thumbnail!
And an attempted release where a plan exists that does not have View permissions:
!jirareleasebad.png|thumbnail!

Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Bamboo plan that a given user has View and Build permissions
# Create a JIRA version
# Attempt to release that version via JIRA's Build and Release
# A popup should appear allowing you to pick available plans to release from. This is working as intended
# Remove "View" permission from the Bamboo plan for the user
# Attempt to release the Version again. JIRA will now show the error message in the attached image.

Expected Result:
* Bamboo plan isn't listed in dropdown if View permission is not set.

Actual Result:
* Error message appears preventing the release from happening

Theory:
JIRA is getting a list of plans from Bamboo where $USER has Build permission. It then tries to get the name of the plan from Bamboo for each returned plan. This fails since $USER doesn't have View permission.

This is happening on our setup of JIRA 6.3.4 and Bamboo 5.6.0
fields.summary: Version "Build and Release" errors when Bamboo plan has Build but not View permissions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
User is unable to list the projects in JIRA that are mapped or contain active links with projects in Bamboo. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the users with the ability to display a list of all the JIRA projects that are mapped/linked with active Bamboo projects. The example in the image below shows the active links between JIRA projects and FishEye:
 !Fisheye_Jira_configuration.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Map JIRA and Bamboo projects

fields.description:
As a user of JIRA's software,
 I would like a lock button (defaults to on) that prevents issues from being re-organised
 So that I don't accidentally move issues around when scrolling on a touchscreen device.

Basically, JIRA is nigh on impossible to interact with using a "pocketable" mobile device. (In my case, ZTE T83 with the Firefox web browser.) Not only does the UI need lots of screen real-estate (a problem even on many laptops with 1366×768 pixel screens), but in the backlog, the (small!) elements respond to dragging events almost instantly.

This is exacerbated by having minimal space to stick ones finger that isn't a task entry. The end result being when tapping on tasks or attempting to scroll, the task is often moved to a wildly different position. Add some lag, and you've got a recipe for making a right dog's breakfast of the carefully curated ordering of tasks.

The tasks should be *fixed* in their position, unless the user explicitly tells JIRA that they wish to alter positions, indicated by a padlock icon or similar, at which point the old behaviour should be restored allowing re-arrangement of tasks. The same UI element should also make it possible to re-enable the lock.

(Thanks to Nic Brough for pointing this JIRA instance out to me.)
fields.summary: JIRA backlog needs a lock button to prevent accidental re-arranging of tasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When viewing the development panel an avatar is shown instead of the user name.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way of displaying the user name instead of the avatar.
 
h3. Workaround 

Mouse over the avatar to get the user's name.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Software user I want the user name to appear instead of the avatar when viewing the Development Panel

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When viewing the JIRA development panel, all files are not shown unless 'Show all files' is ticked.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way to 'Show all files' by default.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Software user I want to show all files by default when viewing the Development Panel

fields.description:
The Epic ticket usually has both features and feature bugs in it. That said, there is no way to do the following in that view:
# Filter column by status
# Filter column by type
# Add column and filter by priority
# Filter column by assignee
# Add column and filter by reporter
# Add column and filter by sprint
# and more...same as available columns in search

WHY?
* We are pushing to develop by epic (in order to have a potentially shippable product increment and we are using epics to do so per agile development 101). Right now we can't assign an epic to a sprint in a clearer way than this.

Screenshot of epic view:
http://cl.ly/image/0t3A340R1r1Y
fields.summary: As a user, when viewing issues within an epic ticket, I should have some of the same abilities I have in issue search view.

fields.description:
Currently, Swimlanes have the option to base themselves using Stories. This is a very helpful feature; however it is somewhat limited when multiple teams are working on the same Story and a user wants to get a quick view of each team's work within the Agile Board view.

My proposal would be to segregate the list of Sub-Tasks in each Story by a label that has been added to each Sub-Task. Each segregated list of Sub-Tasks would list themselves underneath a heading which would be a Label.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile User, I would like to be able to segregate sub-tasks using labels when basing swimlanes on Stories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using 'GG' to perform issue transitions (e.g: press 'gg' and type 'Done' should transition the issue to Done) stops working after the first time. The following attempts on a different issue will look like the action will be performed, but the board will just refresh and the issue will not be transitioned.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA v1000.305.0 - Cloud
* JIRA Agile v1000.37.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a board with a few issues on it.
# Click on an issue and press 'gg' (or dot {{.}}). Then, type the name of the transition you want to perform.
# Repeat with another issue.

h3. Expected Results

The second issue will also be transitioned.

h3. Actual Results

The board refreshes, but the issue is not transitioned.
 
h3. Notes

Once the bug happens, dragging issues will also fail.

h3.Workarounds

Either one should serve as a workaround:

Refreshing the page.
Using the mouse to move issues instead of the keyboard shortcut.
fields.summary: Performing "GG" issue actions on a board work only the first time

fields.description:
Typically our user stories have a development and testing sub-tasks.

The creation of these sub-tasks is very repetitive.

It would be appreciated if there was a Workflow Create Post Function to create sub-tasks.

I understand that the subtaskmanager plug-in makes this possible - but I feel that this is core functionality that should not require a 20% premium on top of the monthly cost.
fields.summary: Automatically Create Sub-tasks on Issue Creation

fields.description:
h5. Description

Currently sub-tasks can be created within Epics, upon clicking the respective link on workflow actions at the issue view. The Epic Link field, although, remains unavailable on the sub-task creation screen;

h5. Suggestion
Prevent sub-tasks from being created directly on the Epic, as sub-tasks are ideally meant to be created under a parent story. 

(i) ^This request possible some variation of JRA-7990.^
fields.summary: Epics should not allow sub-tasks without a parent story

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the system shows the following description for the *Select field (cascading)* custom field.  

!Pasted_Image_31_08_16_13_02.png|thumbnail! 

This description is poor and does not describe the entire functionality of this field.

h3. Suggested Solution

This could be updated to something more accurate like: 	

_Multiple select lists where the options for the second select list dynamically updates based on the value of the first_
fields.summary: Update description for Select field (cascading) custom field
Ability to see 'Time Spent' in 'Workload by Assignee' summary

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Per the implementation of edit/delete "Comments" in the Issue details panel in JIRA 7.2:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-6134

The Comment is now performed in the details panel rather than a modal popup.  and has a small footprint, while the sidebar can be expanded, on small monitors or low resolution monitors the option to expand is limited, and is desirable as a popup for some users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a comment/edit button to use the modal popup to add/edit a comment in tandem with the new inline comment feature to increase flexibility for user preference
fields.summary: Add Modal popup to Issue details panel for comment

fields.description:
PROBLEM:

In cases where two JIRA instances are linked together, you are able to search an issue from JIRA A to using JIRA B (vice versa) and create a link from there. However, it is not possible to search a filter in from one instance to another. 

 
h3. SUGGESTION:

It would be great if we would be able to search a filter from JIRA A using JIRA B (vice versa) and be able to add a it on a Filter Result gadget in a dashboard. Let say, in JIRA A, I have a filter named "Test Filter", I would like to use the same filter in my JIRA B and add it on my dashboard using Filter Result gadget.
fields.summary: Ability to Add a Filter Result from Other Instances into JIRA Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to click anything in the browser window after attaching a file to an issue of the 'Story' issue type, users are unable to click on anything within the JIRA UI

h3. Environment
Cloud - v1000.285.1
Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Project
# Select Backlog
# Select Story
# Select Edit
# Drag Attachment to Edit modal
# Select Update
# Attempt to select anything in the browser

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to select something within the JIRA UI i.e., another issue, link in the menu bar, etc.

h3. Actual Results
The mouse cursor will not change based on what you are mousing over nor will it allow you to click on anything.
 
h3. Notes
This appears to be only happening with 'Story' issues. Testing with other issue types, this does not happen

h3.Workaround
Refreshing the browser window enables the JIRA UI to function again
Using a different browser if possible will alleviate this issue as well
fields.summary: After attaching a file to a JIRA ticket via the Edit modal window, the JIRA UI becomes unresponsive in Internet Explorer 11 / IE11

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A board can have multiple administrators
When, on a board with multiple administrator, a filter is accidentally changed by one of the board administrators, with a filter that is not shared, the board is only visible to the owner of the filter.

The other board administrators are unable to see the board, thus are unable to reverse the change or make adjustment.
  
h3. Suggested Solution
Make the board visible to the board administrators so the filter change can be reverted.
fields.summary: Board administrators should be able to see a board, even though the filter is not shared.

fields.description:
We cannot currently retrieve the Card Colours in JIRA as they are not available via the public JIRA Software REST API.

A read-only endpoint is required for us to solve a feature request for [Easy Agile User Story Maps|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.kretar.jira.plugin.user-story-map].

Thank you,
 Nicholas Muldoon, Product Manager
[Easy Agile|http://easyagile.com]
fields.summary: Expose Card Colours in JIRA Software API

fields.description: I need to know when actions & comments were made by timestamps. Now all I can see is recent history like "yesterday" or "5 days ago". It's really hard to manage with such ambiguity. This is _super_ unhelpful. Major frowny faces to follow.. :( :( :_( :(
fields.summary: Why did you get rid of timestamps in the comments, activity, etc?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14757].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Sprint Health gadget is not correctly reporting Scope Change when changes have been made to the Original / Remaining Time Estimates within a Sprint

h3. Environment
Cloud 1000.285.1
Server Current

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Sprint
# Create several issues
# Add Original / Remaining Time Estimates to the issues
# Add these issues to the Sprint
# Start the Sprint
# Create several more issues
# Estimate these issues the same way you did the original issues
# Add these new issues to the Sprint
# Confirm the Scope Change
# Add the Sprint Health gadget to a Dashboard

h3. Expected Results
The Sprint Health gadget should display relevant information based on the sprint. The Scope Change should read something other than 0%

h3. Actual Results
The Sprint Health gadget displays 0% for the Scope Change
 
h3. Notes
When setting this up, make sure that your Estimation configuration is set for Original Time Estimate within your board as well

h3.Workaround
There is no work around currently
fields.summary: The Sprint Health gadget does not estimate Scope Change at all when Scope Change has occurred

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14756].

Sprint Burndown Gadget have a broken layout and only displays part of the graphics, specially when the Dashboard layout is set to use 3 columns.

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14755].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The Sprint Burndown Chart gadget is not displayed properly:

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* 
* Jira Cloud version: 1000.285.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Step 2

h3. Expected Results
Sprint Burndown Chart gadget should display the full information 

h3. Actual Results
The information is cut off. 
*  !Sprint Burndown Chart.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Have a future sprint with estimated work in it, say 5 issues at 2 points each.
 # Before you start the sprint, resolve one of the issues.
 # Start the sprint a couple of minutes later.
 # Resolve the remaining 4 issues.

What happens:
 * When viewing the Sprint Health Gadget for that sprint, you will see the green bar read "10 points completed".
 * When viewing the Sprint Report for that sprint, you will see "8 points completed" in the table.

What is expected:

Both the reports and the gadget should have a consistent view of (completed) sprint scope.
fields.summary: Sprint health gadget has a different count of completed scope than the Sprint Report and Burndown Chart

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Documentation for the [Sprint Burndown Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Gadgets+for+JIRA+applications] indicates that:
{quote}The vertical axis represents your configured [estimation statistic|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Configuring+estimation+and+tracking].{quote}

This is not true when Time Tracking is enabled on the chosen board; the Gadget will only display the "Remaining Time Estimate"
fields.summary: Update Usability Description for Sprint Burndown Gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sprint Health gadget is truncated in Wallboard mode when below layout is selected.
- !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Have a dashboard and add _Sprint Health_ gadget and other gadget next to it (on the right side)
# Edit the dashboard layout and select this layout
#* !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# View as Wallboard

h3. Actual Results

The gadget is truncated.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The _Sprint Health_ gadget is shown correctly.

h3. Workaround

Select different dashboard layout.
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget is truncated in Wallboard mode

fields.description: Can we have the ability to create a "backlog" status in subtasks on the Jira board?
fields.summary: Backlog status in subtask

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting issues that are part of an Epic using the Excel CSV export option, the Epic Name field is not exported at all

h3. Environment
Cloud - 1000.275.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic
# Create several new issues under this new Epic
# Export the issues to Excel CSV

h3. Expected Results
Issues should be exported with the Epic Name being displayed 

h3. Actual Results
The Epic Name column is completely empty
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Epic Name field is empty when exporting issues to Excel CSV format

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As a JIRA administrator, I would like to be able to customize the level of "write" access in a Read/Write LDAP directory setup.

*Use Case Scenario*: Ability to have users change their LDAP password from within Jira without allowing full write access to LDAP.

There are many use case scenarios where we cannot provide full write access to JIRA (not generally recommended) but can benefit from some write access to some extent.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administartor, I would like to be able to customize the level of "write" access in a Read/Write LDAP directory setup

fields.description:
h3. Problem:
When you don't have permission to set an Epic link (edit permission is necessary on the project of the Epic ticket) JIRA does not show any errors, does not display any indication of the lack of permission.

h3. Solution
Improve error message displayed when the user doesn't have permission to link an epic, insert a message warning that the user does not have permission, what permission the user needs and in what project.

h3. Workaround:
You have to check with permission helper if user has edit permission on the project and check in the documentation that he needs that permission to edit issues: [Adding an Issue to an epic|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-epics/adding-an-issue-to-an-epic]
fields.summary: Error message setting epic link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When JIRA is linked with Bitbucket Server, the user is able to create branches on Bitbucket from JIRA issues. 
On the branch creation screen, JIRA suggests a branch name which contains the issue key, which is necessary for the link to be established. If the user removes the issue key from the name, the branch won't be linked to the JIRA issue. This may lead to some confusion, as some users may expect the branch to be linked, as it was created from the JIRA issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since the link between the branch and a JIRA issue is based on the issue key in the branch name, and the branch name is editable, my suggestion includes:
* A warning to be shown on the branch creation popup when the user is creating a branch from a JIRA issue without including the issue key in the branch name. This warning could either show up as a red warning under the Branch Name field, updated in real time as the user removes the issue key from the branch name, or a message to be acknowledged when the user tries to create a branch without the issue key.
* If opting by a message to be acknowledged, I also suggest the possibility to disable this feature, as some users may find it annoying.
fields.summary: Display warning when creating a branch not including the issue key

ERROR: The field layout item with id 12729 has a reference to the deleted custom field with id customfield_10006. (JRA-4423)
ERROR: The field layout item with id 12730 has a reference to the deleted custom field with id customfield_10702. (JRA-4423)
ERROR: The field layout item with id 12731 has a reference to the deleted custom field with id customfield_10010. (JRA-4423)
{noformat}

Then I have enable back Jira Agile, make re-index and run integrity checker. No errors were found.

I've got this scenario on 2 Jira instances and the result is the same: disabling Jira Agile causes errors. This is not critical but I hope you'll fix it.

Best regards, Alina.
fields.summary: Disabling Jira Agile makes errors "a reference to the deleted custom field"

fields.description: Given that I have sub-tasks in the tickets, when I look at the JIRA board, the priority view is lost (see attached screenshot). Changing the base swimlanes from administrator didn't solve the problem either. It's required to show priority in the active board.
fields.summary: JIRA board with sub-tasks lost the priority view

fields.description:
As a user I would like to have the ability to search for issues (ex. Stories and Bugs) that do not have original estimates in their Sub Tasks.

The Σ Original Estimate field shows this value but we cannot use this field once it is not stored in JIRA, it is just a field that shows the sum value.

It is also not possible to perform a SUM operation when using JQL.
fields.summary: Search for issues where the original estimate sum of their sub tasks is empty or 0.

fields.description:
Currently adding an issue puts it at the bottom of the backlog, with lowest rank. I want to be able to add new issues and see them at the top of the backlog, basically reverse rank. The only way to do this now is to reverse Rank order on the board filter, but that currently breaks drag and drop ranking. So the request to accommodate new issues on top , would be to:

# Allow Kanban board to use ORDER BY Rank DESC , with drag and drop Rank enabled. 
# OR :  default new issues to have the highest rank, instead of the lowest
fields.summary: Allow Kanban boards to use Rank DESC in Board filter / Reverse Rank

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
User wants to view more issue at once in the board

h3. Suggested Solution
Reduce the height of the card
 
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Ability to change card layout size

fields.description: Previously I had a post-function in place to automatically assignee a sub-task (e.g., defects, tech tasks) to the parent issue assignee. Following the removal of JIRA Miscellaneous Workflow Extensions from JIRA Cloud, oftentimes, the issues are going unassigned because it was a habit knowing the post-function was in place. My suggestion for the assignee control for sub-task creation would be to add a quick link for "Assign Parent Assignee' to remove the added search for them in the current control.
fields.summary: Create Issue: Assignee for Sub-Task - Add Quick Link to Assign to Parent Owner

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When users add *status* in Card Layout configuration of Backlog view, it shows in 2 lines.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

When users add status in Card Layout configuration of Backlog view, it shows in 2 lines. If you have a long Sprint Backlog, you will lose the overview of all tickets when every ticket takes up 2 lines.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Display the status of issue within 1 line.
fields.summary: Display Card Layout additional field in 1 line in Backlog View

fields.description: Create product filter, using ajax and bootstrap in the front-end, and Java, Spring MVC, Hibernate, Maven, MySQL at back-end.
fields.summary: Create product filter for online smartphone store

fields.description:
For example we had one huge user story with 13 points. Let’s call it “Story A -> 13 points”. We made following changes:

* Grooming was performed and decision was to create a two smaller stories.
* The “Story A” was renamed and it’s estimation was reduced to 5 points.
* We created a “Story B” with 5 points for example.
* The scope was much smaller than we thought before, so now we have 10 points in summary instead of 13.
* What Jira has done with charts -> disaster!

JIRA charts -> Jira project baseline was reduced by 8points (the middle part of each bar in project burn down chart) and a new scope has appeared - > 5points added in the bottom of current sprint bar. It shouldn’t be done in this way. We should have option to mark that this new item was based on previously generated “mother” story. The proper behavior should be different -> the baseline should be reduced by 3 points and this new groomed story should be treated as a part of baseline.

The other much worse situation is when you decide to delete old story and create a two new stories instead, then these 13 points from baseline disappear.

Is there any workaround to fix this? Somehow edit the original baseline content? Or some other way of splitting issues?

Best Regards

Per Olofsson
fields.summary: Splitting an estimated issue destroys burndown and velocity

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When closing a sprint with unfinished issues and moving them to a new sprint, the value of the *Sprint* field is changed to having both the complete sprint and the new sprint that the issue belongs. However, if the issue is moved from one sprint to another before the sprint is completed, only the current sprint will be displayed on the *Sprint* field.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Allow the option to add sprints that aren't yet completed to the *Sprint* field to show up as *Past-sprint*.
fields.summary: Past sprints on issue's sprint field

fields.description: I am the new Data Associate at ProGeorgia. I should have the ability to Export lists on VAN, however when I try to do this I am forwarded to a page asking me to form a request (which goes to my colleague Nick, the Data Manager). I need to have the ability to Export lists without this additional step. I'm sure I don't have this ability yet just because I am new to the system. Thanks for your help!
fields.summary: I need access to Export lists on VAN

fields.description:
The system dashboard has the following instructions to request a new feature:

To create a feature request: Log in or create an account, then hit Create in the header.

After logging in, I'm directed to a Manage your account page. It Is go to the JIRA home page, there is no Create option in the header.
If I do a search for Create feature request, the search results do not return the information I'm looking for.

What I'm trying to mention is the following:
The new location of the More button has poor UX. It's separated from all of the other buttons. It's on the right side of the screen. This is not logical. Studies show that almost all users' attention immediately focuses to the top left area of the screen.
fields.summary: Instructions on system dashboard unclear and/or incorrect

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to access epic progress statistics via the JIRA Software REST API.

This feature is required for Arijea to address a top-requested feature of [Easy Agile User Story Maps|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.kretar.jira.plugin.user-story-map] and [Easy Agile Roadmaps|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.arijea.easy-agile-roadmaps].
fields.summary: Expose Epic Statistics in JIRA Software API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14707].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Drag and drop of issues on Kanban board is triggering a javascript error: Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'top' of null

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sample project of Kanban type.
# Visit the Kanban board for the first time, select any issue to Expand the Issue Details View in right sidebar.
# Navigate away from the Kanban board and then return to the Kanban board by selecting it from the Board menu. The last viewed issue should still be active (selected), and Issue Details View should be expanded for this issue (Jira remembered this for us).
# Try to DRAG any OTHER issue on the board by click and HOLD of the left mouse button. It is important to take this step right after opening the Kanban board, and not to left-click any issue beforehand on this screen.

h3. Expected Results
The dragged issue should becomes selected in the Issue Detail view, and you can transition the issue by dragging it to another column.

h3. Actual Results
A Javascript error pops-up 
bq. "Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'top' of null" 
pops up, and the issue can't be moved.
 
h3. Notes/Workaround
# The error is triggered only when Issue Details View in right sidebar is already expanded when user visit the Board. If it's collapsed (hidden), the no error will be thrown.
# The error is triggered only when user tries to Drag issues that aren't shown in the Issue Details View, i.e. all issues except the currently selected one. If user tries to Drag currently selected issue, no error is thrown.
# The error is thrown only if no issue selection events took place on the Board since user opened it. If any issue where explicitly selected by the user and the contents of the Issue Details View where reloaded, then no error will be shown.
fields.summary: Javascript errors when dragging issues on Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in Agile/Software Project, if *other workflows* is in use or you have *modified* the 'Simplified Workflow for your Agile's Board, this will impact the presentation of data in the Report. Where some issue using the new status introduce in this workflow will not be showing in the Report, unless you have mapped this status in the column management in the board's configuration.

This is rather a manual effort needed on the user side, as well as if the users are not aware of this, they will be presented with the inaccurate data for their reports

h3. Suggested Solution
* To update the documentation for JIRA Software Workflow to warned user on the impact of not using the default simplified workflow
* To update the documentation to educate user regarding the need to remap the statuses for the boards column, in order for the report to work correctly
* Provide informative warning during a modification of the simplified workflow
fields.summary: Changing/Modifying workflow impact report

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the ability to sort and customise the columns to display under the "Issues in Epic" section inside an issue:

!issues_epic.png!

This way, for example, we would be able to add a "due date" column and sort the list by it.
fields.summary: Ability to sort and customise the columns under the "Issues in Epic" section

fields.description:
This is a more specific request than JRA-34630 (full customization of the columns in "Issues in epic" section), so perhaps is quicker to implement.  When viewing an epic issue, and reviewing the list of issues in an epic in the "Issues in epic" section, it includes several columns, some with just icons.

The Priority of each issue in the epic is critical to know when reviewing the status of the linked issues - but is not one of those columns included in the "Issues in epic" section!

Please add a column that shows the priority icon for each issue.  Presumably, since it's an icon, this will add minimal horizontal space, but greatly improve the useful info for items in that list.

While I would love to see you add JRA-34630, perhaps this more tactical enhancement can be made more quickly.
fields.summary: Add "Priority" icon as a column in "Issues in epic" section
Improve unreleasedVersions() documentation

fields.description:

Quoting from [Application Links Version Matrix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Application+links+version+matrix]

\{quote}

You should ensure your applications are using the same major version of AppLinks to resolve any potential incompatibilities.

\{quote}

 

Creating the application link between the below versions don't seem to work. Even they are having same major applinks plugin versions.

 *  JIRA 6.4.5 has Applink version 4.3.5

!applink.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. SUGGESTION:

Please update the documentation as it is giving misleading information to the users.
fields.summary: Application Link Version Matrix Documentation Update

Currently in Sprint Report users are not able to view which Epic does the issue in the Sprint belongs to.

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

When a swimlane is created, the header shows the name of the swimlane, status and number of sub-tasks present in the swimlane.

 

*Feature Request*

Can a feature be added to the swimlane configuration that allows the board or system admin modify the information that is present in the swimlane header, for example being able to hide the number of sub-task or status of the swimlane from users who view the board.

 

*Current Behavior*

There are no features to modify the swimlane header at the moment other than the name and what it contains as explained here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Configuring+swimlanes?preview=/764478010/824352280/Swimlanes%20with%20stories%20setting.png
fields.summary: Add Feature to Customize Swimlane Header Content

To get the release notes i have to then click around for a bit to get to that section. It would be really useful if, when searching on fix version, a link could be shown to jump to the release notes page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user miskeys their Estimation for Story Point values to a value in excess of 2 Billion Story Points, the Burndown Chart displays an inaccurate Story Points Y-Axis
If the mistake was identified and corrected during the Sprint, the change is still stored and causes the Chart to skew

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.217.1 
* JIRA Server 7.1.8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum Board with Estimation Statistics of Story Points
# Create a Story Issue and input a Story Points value more than 2 Billion (2000000000)
# Start a Sprint with this Story Issue
# End Sprint and view the Burndown Chart

h3. Expected Results
- User receives a warning indicating they've input a value which may not be accurate; Feature Request for Limiting Story Point Values:  JSW-9177
- Burndown chart displays an accurate Y-Axis value 

h3. Actual Results
If a Story Point value of 2000000001:
 !2000000001 Story Points.png|thumbnail! 

In excess a value of 8888888888; y-axis is no longer sequential and the total number of Story Points in the table do not match the actual number of Story Points on the issue.
 !8888888888 Story Points.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Environmental factors could cause a user to input an incorrect value, a 'stick keys' application, broken keyboard, API, etc

h3.Workaround
If the Story Point value is changed during a Sprint, the previous value is still recorded in the sprint. 
The current sprint would need to be completed, the Story Point value corrected, and start a new Sprint.
fields.summary: Large Story Point Values Cause Burndown Chart to Display Incorrect Y-Axis
Keep me logged in not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-14675].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When using JIRA Software, if an issue is '[Flagged|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Flagging+an+Issue]' it will create a custom field "Flagged" which belongs to JIRA Software but is not 'Locked'. As this field is not locked it may become subject to deletion by an attempt to clean up custom fields in the environment. 

h3. Suggested Solution
When the "Flagged field is created, make it locked by default to prevent accidental changes to this field. 
 
h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Lock the Flagged Custom Field used to store impediment value

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to synchronise with a GitHub Enterprise account, a server-side exception was thrown. The DVCS plugin has not stopped attempting to synchronise within the client (ie Chrome) ever since. This affects multiple repositories in the account.

h3. Environment

* DVCS plugin integrated with GitHub Enterprise.
* GitHub Enterprise server cannot be accessed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup DVCS to integrate with GitHub Enterprise.
# Alter the environment in such a way that an {{IOException}} will be thrown when trying to connect to it.
# Synchronise the repository.

h3. Expected Results

The repository fails as per [^sync failed.jpg].

h3. Actual Results

The sync continues perpetually as per [^infinite sync.jpg] and the network tools displays this in [^been going a while.jpg]. The below exception was thrown:

{noformat}
2016-08-03 12:57:14,599 http-nio-6989-exec-22 ERROR superadmin 777x3437x1 1q9iesm 172.22.48.175 /rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/2069/softsync [c.a.j.p.d.sync.impl.DefaultSynchronizer] Could not retrieve list of branchescom.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.exception.SourceControlException: Could not retrieve list of branches
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.github.GithubCommunicator.getBranches(GithubCommunicator.java:624)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.github.GithubCommunicator.startSynchronisation(GithubCommunicator.java:692)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.remote.CachingCommunicator.startSynchronisation(CachingCommunicator.java:208)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.sync.impl.DefaultSynchronizer.doSync(DefaultSynchronizer.java:176)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl.doSync(RepositoryServiceImpl.java:519)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl.sync(RepositoryServiceImpl.java:430)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.rest.RootResource.startRepositorySoftSync(RootResource.java:233)
        ... 3 filtered
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
        ... 19 filtered
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter$JerseyOsgiServletContainer.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:154)
        ... 1 filtered
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:68)
        ... 86 filtered
        at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.doFilter(JiraSecurityFilter.java:70)
        ... 16 filtered
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestSeraphFilter.doFilter(RestSeraphFilter.java:37)
        ... 74 filtered
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.net.UnknownHostException: git.example.com
        at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connect(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:184)
        at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(SocksSocketImpl.java:392)
        at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:589)
        at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.connect(SSLSocketImpl.java:668)
        at sun.net.NetworkClient.doConnect(NetworkClient.java:175)
        at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(HttpClient.java:527)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsClient.<init>(HttpsClient.java:264)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsClient.New(HttpsClient.java:367)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.https.AbstractDelegateHttpsURLConnection.getNewHttpClient(AbstractDelegateHttpsURLConnection.java:191)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect0(HttpURLConnection.java:1105)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect(HttpURLConnection.java:999)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.https.AbstractDelegateHttpsURLConnection.connect(AbstractDelegateHttpsURLConnection.java:177)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream0(HttpURLConnection.java:1513)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1441)
        at java.net.HttpURLConnection.getResponseCode(HttpURLConnection.java:480)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getResponseCode(HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java:338)
        at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.GitHubClient.get(GitHubClient.java:733)
        at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.PageIterator.next(PageIterator.java:173)
        at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.service.GitHubService.getAll(GitHubService.java:151)
        at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.service.GitHubService.getAll(GitHubService.java:135)
        at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.service.RepositoryService.getBranches(RepositoryService.java:785)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.github.GithubCommunicator.getBranches(GithubCommunicator.java:588)
        ... 214 more
{noformat}

h3. Notes

Querying the endpoint for the failing repo, /rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/2068, shows us the sync has failed, however it seems the client is not accessing that endpoint for some reason:

{code:java}
{
  "id": 2068,

}

{code}

fields.description:
I want to have option similar to how I can configure columns for sub-tasks, see screenshot.
Current default list is not very convenient for me, I need to see Version, Sprint, Resolution.
Default attributes I can see is not enough, definitely.
fields.summary: Option to configure columns to show when viewing issues in an epic

fields.description:
My QA team uses a sprint board that aggregates all sprints in the organization. Sometimes a backlog can have several issues that have to be rendered on a page. This makes the loading time and the interface a little too cumbersome.

Perhaps a "show more" link after 10 issues could help. Any change to the interface that would help in this matter would be appreciated.
fields.summary: "show more" for JIRA sprints or boards without changing constraints.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Decription

Clicking Backlog button on the sidebar, doesn't retain the Quick Filter selection and Epic/Version panel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a project and a Scrum board
# Create a Quick filter and an issue
# Go to Backlog, expand Version and Epic panel and click the Quick filter
# Click on any of the issues and it will be redirected to the _View Issue_ screen
# Press {{g}} and then {{a}} (JIRA shortcut to go back to board) or press back button on the browser, it will redirect back to the backlog with Version and Epic panel are still expanded and Quick Filter is still selected
# Click on any of the issues and it will be redirected to the _View Issue_ screen again
# Click {{Backlog}} icon on sidebar

h3. Expected Result

Version and Epic panel are expanded and Quick Filter is selected.

h3. Actual Result 

Version and Epic panel are not expanded and Quick Filter is not selected.
fields.summary: Clicking Backlog doesn't retain the Quick filter selection and Epic/Version panel

fields.description:
In planning and resource tool and plugins there is frequently a problem where in the planning tools you have to use some date field on the issue to do planning, or artificial date to do resource planning.  It would be much nicer to be able to have plugins that would be sprint aware for planning schedule and resources.  But to do this, the sprints really need to have dates (at least planned/estimated dates).  This would make life SO much easier than having to both plan sprints, and then try to put appropriate start or due dates on individual issues.

So, my proposal is to, at least optionally, allow future sprints to be created with a planned start and stop date.
Many teams work on standard 2 weeks sprints, so the planned start and end will almost always match the actual start and stop once the sprint is active.
fields.summary: Allow a planned/estimated start and stop time on inactive sprints

fields.description: JIRA Core publishes on at https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/jira-rest-plugin.wadl - it would be awesome for us to get one for JIRA Software.
fields.summary: Please publish a wadl for the rest api

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Burndown Chart displays Remaining estimate in weeks and days when it is more than 24hours. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful if the remaining estimate is displayed in hours without being rounded to weeks and days.
fields.summary: Option to display burndown chart in hours only

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you access any board, and expand the issues details by clicking on it, you will not be able to collapse the description of the issue, although we are able when opening the full issue.
h3. Environment

Cloud environment

JIRA v1000.148.3

Chrome

Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter in the board where you have issues, or create them
 # Click on any issues to expand the details of it on the right side of the screen
 # Try to click on the left arrow to collapse the description of the issue

h3. Expected Results

The description of the issue should collapse as it happens when you open the issue on a separate tab of your browser.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens
h3. Notes

On Chrome's console:
{code:java}
DEPRECATED JS - Dropdown constructor has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Use Dropdown2 instead. 
 at Object.exports.bindConfigDashboardDds ([https://d2p4ir3ro0j0cb.cloudfront.net/invaluable.atlassian.net/s/b4fca338df]…/_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3875:604)\{code}

{code}
Did not found any  errors on JIRA's logs
h3. Workaround

 

Open the issue on a separate tab of the browser.
fields.summary: Not able to collapse description of Issues on Board's detail view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

[Integrating with development tools|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Integrating+with+development+tools] should be only for JIRA Software projects in JIRA. Since after JIRA 7, we have JIRA project's type; Business and Software, then features from development tool integration such Development Panel should not be applied to JIRA non-Software projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate JIRA 7.1.9 to Bitbucket cloud account - [Integrating with development tools|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Integrating+with+development+tools].
 # Navigate to a non-Software JIRA project's issue - notice that the Development Panel is being shown on the issue.

h3. Expected Results

No Development Panel is being shown.
h3. Actual Results

Development Panel is being shown on the issue.
h3. Workaround

Fine tune all the non-Software JIRA projects' [permission scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-project-permissions-802592442.html] to restrict who can see the Development Panel - View development tools permission.
fields.summary: Development Panel should not be shown on non-Software projects' issues

fields.description:
*_As a_* person preparing release on a multi-repository project looking at a ticket's Pull Request list
 *_I want_* be able to easily tell PRs that implement the fix (branch name or PR title contains the ticket) from other pull requests that merely mention the ticket
 *_So that_* I don't accidentally merge a PR that implements a different ticket

*_As a_* developer collaborating on code in a multi-repository project
 *_I want_* be able to mention any ticket in my [PR description, commit message, comment] without worrying about causing mistakes during release
 *_So that_* I can share all the important information about tickets related to my change

In our team the project spans a great many repositories. Because of that there is almost always 4~5 Pull Requests that a ticket introduces. So, a ticket's PR dialog is used as the authoritative information to tell which pull requests should be merged to release a the ticket's feature. Moreover, merges are done by the QA team which is not involved in details of the development.

We could easily prevent a mistake of merging a wrong PR if the ones that are associated based on title texts (PR title/source branch) were made much more prominent than those associated on mentions in 'prose texts' (PR description, commit message, code review discussions, if ever implemented).

Some implementation options:
 * Have a separate main list for when ticket occurs in branch name or PR title, and a separate 'Mentioned in' list with all the rest
 (This would be the preferred solution for teams like ours, because of the importance we attach to the main group.)
 * Add pictogram flags next to a PR that show the types of associations which were found
fields.summary: Jira - Show type of association in ticket's pull request list (PR title/branch/comments)

fields.description:
+Current State+
 In order to release from a Kanban board, a user with project administrator permissions must do the release.

+Desired State+

Any member of the team can release one or more issues.

+Rationale+

 We are a CD shop in which each engineer is responsible for performing his or her own releases.  It is unreasonable to give each engineer project administrator permissions
fields.summary: Releasing requires Project Administrator permissions

fields.description:
A friend of mine works in IT in a large bank in the UK that uses JIRA.
This bank is struggling to provide bank statements to its clients that date back more than 3 months.
I know this because was a client of this bank.
I no longer use this bank because of this.


A few months later when looking for a productivity tool for my software engineering company i was introduced to JIRA.
I was very excited with what it could do so i signed up for the cloud. 
After a few weeks with less than a gig of data, I migrated the installation to the Server version.

What a tricky process that was.
Had to hack the backup zip to get it going.
The new server install was still corrupted leaving the avatars and images behind.
I overlooked this thinking this was due to backward incompatibility of server to cloud.
So i carried on.

Ok now Im still evaluating.
Moving from H2 to Postgre
 
What an ordeal!!
Cant restore backup.
First is says the backup is not a zip archive??? 
 Sorry but it is!  Created by the JIRA internal backup process.
aaaarrrrggghhh!
Then now it says entities.xml does not exist in zip archive??
I checked and it does?

What is going on?
BACKUP/ RESTORE process needs to be a simple and reliable process that a company can rely upon.
The integrity of the backup is of paramount importance to any business and IT system.

How can you allow the migration process from H2 to Postgre be so corrupted?
 
JIRA looks like a great system but the backup/restore process can do with some improvement i think. (SUCKS)
After all any system today without a RELIABLE and user friendly, efficient backup process, makes it completely useless.

And why is Mac unsupported? Is it because macs work?

Now i know what the bank is going through.
fields.summary: Database Migration process Unacceptable.

fields.description: As an administrator, I think it would be beneficial if an administrator of a project/sprint could manually calculate in time that was logged on an issue into the burndown scope if the issue was added post-sprint creation. This way, if time was logged on an issue after a sprint was created but the issue wasn't added until later, the time would be accounted for.
fields.summary: Manual Recalculation for Burndown

fields.description:
The information about the sum of estimated issues is already there when the sprint is extended, but not shown when it is collapsed.

* !Collapsed view of not started Sprint.png|thumbnail! 
*  !Extended view of not started Sprint.png|thumbnail! 

The customer would like to have this information at the top, similarly as in the collapsed view of a Sprint that has started.

*  !Collapsed view of started Sprint.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display information about the sum of estimated issues in collapsed view of a not yet started Sprint in Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Kanban Board with "Stories" Swimlanes settings , will display *Sub-task* issue under their parents issue . It's better if can add *Link Type* categories under parents issue . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add additional categories under *Stories* swimlanes , which is *Link Type* categories.
fields.summary: Issue categorise by Link Type when using "Stories" Swimlanes
Greenhopper project progress gadget displayed on login page

fields.description: Add customization to set something up so that with each day, you can display an automated "reminder" of which day you are in the sprint. For example: For Sprint 12, in the box that says there are 15 days left - allow gadget to show "Day 1: Planning Day." OR – just putting this somewhere on the dashboard would be great.  Ideally, this would be automated and somehow pull from the standard calendar.
fields.summary: Greenhopper Days Remaining Dashboard Gadget - allow customization to be able to display current day of sprint and details of day, or sprint.

fields.description: Im trying to edit VF - 1625 but the folder in staging is empty. They are on the site but nowhere else as far as I can tell.
fields.summary: VF-1625 Boy scouts images missing from staging

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As a user, I'd like the ability to change the Due Date color when it is overdue to be something like:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/files/800712866/833928287/1/1468983539435/board+transitions.gif

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide ability to change the Due Date color when it is overdue.
fields.summary: Ability to change the Due Date color when it is overdue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When a user is granted with {{Edit Issues}} and {{Schedule Issues}} permission, they will be able to assign issue to both future and active Sprint. As a user, I'd like to restrict only Scrum master who can assign issue to Active Sprint while the rest can assign issues to future Sprint.
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/permissions-overview-764478244.html#Permissionsoverview-board-usagesprint-related-actionsBoardusage

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a separate permission for users to assign issue to Active and Future Sprint
fields.summary: Provide a separate permission for users to assign issue to Active and Future Sprint

fields.description:
Within the Agile Sprint Health Gadget on my dashboards, the count for 'Blockers' and 'Flagged' is accurate.  On mouseover, they each show a link to their respective filters.  When I click on these links, I am taken to the issue navigator but it does not load the expected filter to reflect the 'blockers' or 'flagged' tickets in the sprint.  Instead, the issue navigator loads with the user's previous query.

Mouseover hyperlinks where Sprint # is '123' and %jira_url% is the url to the jira instance
* Blockers
** http://%jira_url%/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=priority%3D1%20AND%20Sprint%3D123
* Flagged
** http://%jira_url%/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=Flagged!%3Dnull%20AND%20Sprint%3D123
fields.summary: Agile Sprint Health Gadget links load previous query filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the *AND* operator in the JQL query for the same field twice, the board goes missing from the project overview page. 

h3. Environment
# Tested in JIRA 6.4.12 & JIRA 7.1.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum Project ( SCRUM )
# Create a second board from an existing project ( same project as step one )
# Create 2 components in the project ( A, B )
# Create 3 issues
## First issue with component = A
## Second issue with component = B
## Third issue with component = A , B 
# Create 2 Filters
# First filter - using bracket operator for component
{code}
Project = SCRUM AND issuetype = Story AND component in (A, B)
{code}
# Second Filter - using AND operator for component
{code}
project = SCRUM AND issuetype = Story AND component = A AND component = B
{code}
# Go to the Project Overview Page, and noticed that there are 2 boards visible ( SCRUM board & SCRUM board 2 )
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Change the saved filter of SCRUM board 2 to use the Second Filter - using AND operator for component
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Refresh the project overview page

h3. Expected Results
Both boards should be still visible on the project overview page

h3. Actual Results
SCRUM board 2 goes missing, Only the 1st board is displayed. 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
If we changed Saved Filter of the board back to use  :
{code}
Project = SCRUM AND issuetype = Story AND component in (A, B)
{code}
The board is visible again. However, the requirement is to use {{component = A AND component = B}} as we need to return issues with have both components, not either one.
fields.summary: Board does not display on project overview page when AND operator is used in the board's saved filter

fields.description: As a jira-admin I wish the Release Notes that only affect Jira Administrators (i.e. Admin screens) were separated from the Release Notes that affect the End Users (i.e. Front End screens). This would enable me to send a link to the Release Notes to my end users instead of having to find and then cut-n-paste the relevant chunks of information into an email for them.
fields.summary: In Release Notes please separate out "Jira Admin" screen changes and "End User" screen changes

fields.description: we need to have all the stories and Subtasks hours sum in the Epic level. is there any configuration available to get this like what Epic Sum Up add-on is working, but unfortunately this doesn't support in issue navigator to generate the excel sheets
fields.summary: Epic Sum up

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating new issues in a backlog of a project, new issues are automatically ranked based on the currently highlighted issue.


h3. Environment
Cloud / Server


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project
# Start adding tickets
# Continue to add tickets
# Select an issue in the middle of the list
# Continue to add tickets


h3. Expected Results
New tickets should be created at the bottom of the backlog unless otherwise specified in project settings


h3. Actual Results
Tickets will be ranked below highlighted ticket

 
h3. Notes
This appears to only happen whenever the backlog is log enough to scroll off the page


h3.Workaround
Ensure you always have the last issue highlighted when creating issues
fields.summary: Allow the configuration of how new tickets are ranked in the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user creates an issue from the *UI*, and adds an attachment on the *Create screen*, the attachment will be added straight away. 
*However*, if a user sends a *mail* to jira with the same attachment, and it's processed by a *mail handler*, the issue will be created *first*, then only the attachment will be added. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Incoming Mail and add a Mail Handler. 
# Send a mail to JIRA to create a new issue with attachments. 

h3. Expected Results
The issue will be created with the attachments straight away. 

h3. Actual Results 
# The issue is created first and the attachments are added later. 

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: Incoming mail handler adds attachments after the initial create function
